channel.title: Hosting 24/7 on Own Computer?
channel.description:
I'm currently trying to host a 24/7 server from my own spare windows system. I've been searching around google and the forums for a while now, but I'm looking for ways to monitor/make sure my server is staying up 24/7, because in the passed when I've been testing it, normally after about 24-48 hours of running, it'll randomly go down(whether because of a syipkpker attack or general error that I never actually looked up on google because I'm stupid). I have also tried to just use a server restarter, but that doesn't always work either, because sometimes when the server gets restarted it doesn't successfully start back up again until the time interval runs out and it is restarted again. Does anyone know of an alert tool of some kind that would play a sound or something if my server were to go down? or a server restarter that pings my rsps and will only restart the server if it see's that it's down(this would be ideal)? I do realize that it would be best for me to just use a VPS or something for a 24/7 rsps, but I don't have any experience with linux, and I feel like if I was going to pay for a windows vps, I might as well host it myself anyway and save the money.
Thanks for the help.

item.title: Hosting 24/7 on Own Computer?
item.dc:creator: @fatalpop fatalpop
item.description:
@fatalpop wrote:

[quote=“i am infamy, post:8, topic:447291”][quote author=fatalpop link=topic=550195.msg4032768#msg4032768 date=1340926590]

Well then dont plan on having a working server

My server already does work, I just need help with keeping it up 24/7, I just don’t plan on running random non-reputable programs like the one you linked, sorry.

Like i said your loss im not gunna sit here and try and help you and you automatically think its some sort of bad program…

Give me a online virus scanner and ill post you the results.

next time dont be so hard headed

I’m not being hard headed, I just feel like anyone should automatically post a virus scan with any sort of program that anyone posts, I had already scanned it, anyway.
[/quote]

Okay but if some1 is helping you its just respect to say thanks instead of making everything negative.[/quote]

Can we please get this thread back to talking about the original reason that I posted this please, Thanks.

Read full topic
